content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a quick and fun puzzle
well suited for clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution, because: I liked it, the description is clear, it is easy to understand, it can be solved quickly for a clash of code, and it also helps to practice loops, conditionals, and to use logic, I programmed the solution and everything worked perfectly, Thank you very much :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the 'escape game' universe. The puzzle is quite simple and good for a clash (for all 3 modes)
Now the contribution is much better than the previous great work. Here is my upvote. For approval I will have to wait for a while to see more opinions and reviews.

I had been waiting for this contribution to be more finalised before making any comments, but alas, the ERROR condition/case was modified and the contribution was immediately published. I would be grateful if the author could wait a bit longer before publishing the contribution, especially when this is the author's first contribution.

But anyway…

Please fix the points raised by @Ayush-Kukreti, and also:

Goal
* As mentioned by @Ayush-Kukreti, the statement is too long with non-essential details.

* I don't like the sound of these two sentences, like, why do I have to think in the same way as you do?
"What happens after that... well, that's not your problem."

"They’ll use that information for their sick plans, but that’s none of your business, is it?"

I suggest to delete the sentences, but it's entirely up to the author to decide.

Input
* Please delete the example.

* This description seems irrelevant now? "-> may or may not contain steps represented by symbols"

Output
* Please change to the following (and remember to delete the example):
<<Line 1>>: {{Room Escaped}}
<<Line 2>>: [[total_time]] -> total time taken to escape the room in seconds
<<or>>
<<Line 1>>: {{ERROR}}

Thanks.

Hello contributor!
thanks for your contribution as i want to say only this you can reduce goal section as for clash of code the goal section is to long 

*Goal:
You need to calculate the time it takes for a victim to escape a room based on the following symbols in their path:

[[.]] = Move forward {{1}} step ({{2}} seconds)
[[<]] = Move backward {{2}} steps ({{2}} seconds)
[[|]] = Stop for {{5}} seconds
Add {{2}} seconds for a final step forward to escape. If the total time is {{10 }}seconds or less, output {{ERROR}. Otherwise, output "{{Room Escaped}}" and the time.
the goal is exactly same in short.

*In Test cases;-
Validator should be similar to test cases but not identical.

Please rework on your contribution and make it more understandable with easy language.
Excited to share my first contribution on this site! Your support means a lot—please check it out and let me know what you think!
I want to include a case for faulty cells where there is no input, but I'm unable to do so because it requires all inputs and outputs to be provided. How can I add this case?
Maybe input an invalid character or a space?

Thank you both for your thoughtful feedback and support on my first contribution!

I’ve carefully considered the suggestions and have made changes to simplify the goal section and revise the input/output descriptions for clarity. The feedback from @Ayush-Kukreti and both of you has been really valuable in helping me refine my work. I’ve also removed unnecessary details and reworked the test cases to ensure they align better with the intended validator format.

Unfortunately, I’ve encountered some issues with the site not updating my previous submission, so I will be creating a new one altogether after removing this. The revised version will reflect all the improvements discussed, and I look forward to hearing your thoughts once it’s live.

Thanks again for your patience and guidance!


*Error I encountered
Oops
An error occurred (#572): "You do not have the last contribution version".

It may be a bit confusing to use the words "path" and "steps" as players may misunderstand the input string to be a map and try to calculate the position of the victim. Hence I'll suggest a few changes as follows:

Goal
* Suggest to change "following symbols in their path" to "the victim's actions, represented by the following symbols".

Input
* Suggest to change "steps" to "actions taken to escape the room,".

Constraints
* Please delete the two constraints as they are not relevant to the solution. (e.g. it's entirely possible that the victim must go only backwards to reach the exit. A really weird series of actions would be one which contains "|" only.)

+++++

In addition, I would like to see some edge cases to check whether solutions distinguish ERROR or non-ERROR cases correctly or not.

For example, you may add a case of .<.. adds up to 10 seconds before adding the final 2 seconds, and hence should be a non-ERROR case. So, my suggestions are:

* Change Faulty Cell Validator to contain actions which add up to less than 8 seconds (before adding the final 2 seconds).

* Add a pair of cases where actions add up to exactly 8 seconds (before adding the final 2 seconds). The original case of ..< can be included here.

* Add a pair of cases where actions add up to exactly 10 seconds (before adding the final 2 seconds). The example I gave above of .<.. can be included here.

Thanks.
Thank you for your approval and feedback! I'm thrilled that you liked my escape game, and I’ll do my best to keep improving.

I think you are right as always.
Hope the contributor pay more attention to these points.
Haha, that's an overstatement! I'm just human; I may miss things or get something wrong. Please do keep a critical mindset and point out any issues in my suggestions.

Thank you for your reply.

The error you encountered can be avoided by refreshing the web page before attempting to update and save the contribution again. You don't have to create a new contribution.
Thank you for your suggestion, but using an invalid character or space won't work. It causes issues in the code since both are treated as elements during processing.

Thank you for your thoughts, but I think it would be better to remove that element (the case for no input) and instead add a new element, such as a case for input that takes less than 10 seconds to complete, to avoid any potential issues for now.
